The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning

Comments_List: How to use x-rays to analyze my samples, and which methods would be appropriate in various situations.
Basic knowledge of various synchrotron techniques.
This course did a good job of presenting the range of possible analytical techniques available at a synchrotron.
Various characterization techniques using synchrotron radiation
A lot about how the different techniques at the Synchrotron work and how they can be employed.

Strengths: Lots of material covered, Variety of material covered, geared towards the application of the synchrotron facility

Weaknesses: The variety of instructors can make this course a bit confusing when it comes to the homework sets. Luckily we had an excellent TA!
I don't see how it could be improved.

One suggestion: All 12 or so lecturers for the course were male. Not that it's necessarily a bad thing, and I know it's challenging to arrange speakers coming from Brookhaven, but it would have been nice to have at least one female speaker!

The contents were very interesting and helpful. Since the time for each technique was short, instructors had to skip many things and taught very fast. I would like the course to focus less on physical laws and equations, but more on applications and basic principles.
The problem sets were extremely useful for understanding the techniques and practicing data analysis.
Absolutely! If you would like to know more about the facilities at LBNL NSLS-II, take this course.
Yes, it is a great course if you're in a field where synchrotron techniques are used. Great introduction that covers most of the techniques.

I would recommend this course to another student. The course was well-designed with purposefully chosen speakers and a nice structure with the weekly lectures and doughnuts. Some of the material was less relevant to my particular interests and research, but it was still interesting to learn about the different techniques.
I will because it is very useful for sample characteristics.
Yes! Extremely useful for learning about a wide variety of techniques.
